AT_001.flavor: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.
AT_001.name: Flame Lance

AT_002.name: Effigy
AT_002.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, summon a random minion with the same Cost.

AT_003.name: Fallen Hero

AT_004.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. This spell gets double bonus from Spell Damage.

AT_005.name: Polymorph: Boar
AT_005.text: Transform a minion into a 4/2 Boar with Charge.

AT_006.flavor: Is he aspiring or inspiring?  Make up your mind!
AT_006.name: Dalaran Aspirant

AT_007.flavor: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about.  Who can say?
AT_007.name: Spellslinger
AT_007.text: Battlecry: Add a random spell to each player's hand.

AT_008.flavor: The Grand Tournament has a "No dragons allowed" policy, but it's rarely enforced.

AT_009.name: Rhonin
AT_009.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.

AT_010.flavor: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.
AT_010.name: Ram Wrangler
AT_010.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon a random Beast.

AT_011.flavor: She really likes seeing people get better.  That's why she hurts them in the first place.
AT_011.name: Holy Champion
AT_011.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.

AT_012.flavor: What did you expect to happen?  He's a Spawn.  Of Shadows.
AT_012.name: Spawn of Shadows

AT_013.flavor: The promise of glory is a powerful tool to get minions to do your bidding.  Only slightly less powerful than the promise of an ice cream bar!
AT_013.name: Power Word: Glory
AT_013.text:
Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, restore 4 Health to
your hero.

AT_013E.text: When this attacks, restore 4 Health to the hero of the player who buffed it.

AT_014.flavor: Hopes to be promoted to "Shadowfriend" someday.
AT_014.name: Shadowfiend
AT_014.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).

AT_015.name: Convert
AT_015.text: Put a copy of an enemy minion into your hand.

AT_016.name: Confuse
AT_016.text: Swap the Attack and Health of all minions.

AT_017.flavor: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.
AT_017.name: Twilight Guardian
AT_017.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.

AT_018.flavor: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears.  Most common fear:  Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.
AT_018.name: Confessor Paletress

AT_019.flavor: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament.  Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.
AT_019.name: Dreadsteed

AT_020.flavor: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.
AT_020.name: Fearsome Doomguard

AT_021.flavor: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."
AT_021.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
AT_021.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +1/+1.

AT_022.name: Fist of Jaraxxus
AT_022.text: When you play or discard this, deal $4 damage to a random enemy.

AT_023.name: Void Crusher
AT_023.text: Inspire: Destroy a random minion for each player.

AT_024.flavor: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.
AT_024.name: Demonfuse
AT_024.text: Give a Demon +3/+3. Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.

AT_025.flavor: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.
AT_025.name: Dark Bargain
AT_025.text: Destroy 2 random enemy minions. Discard 2 random cards.

AT_026.flavor: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.
AT_026.name: Wrathguard
AT_026.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, also deal that amount to your hero.

AT_027.flavor:
He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*.
*He's pretty sure this is going to work out.
AT_027.name: Wilfred Fizzlebang
AT_027.text: Cards you draw from your Hero Power cost (0).

AT_028.flavor: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.
AT_028.name: Shado-Pan Rider

AT_029.flavor: The best part of buccaneering is the pants.
AT_029.name: Buccaneer
AT_029.text: Whenever you equip a weapon, give it +1 Attack.

AT_030.flavor: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.
AT_030.name: Undercity Valiant

AT_031.flavor: He has a giant collection of purses now.  One for every outfit!
AT_031.name: Cutpurse
AT_031.text: Whenever this minion attacks a hero, add the Coin to your hand.

AT_032.flavor: I have great deal for you... for 4 damage to your face!
AT_032.name: Shady Dealer
AT_032.text: Battlecry: If you have a Pirate, gain +1/+1.

AT_033.name: Burgle
AT_033.text: Add 2 random class cards to your hand (from your opponent's class).

AT_034.flavor: How much more poisoned can a blade get?  The answer is a lot.  A lot more poisoned.
AT_034.name: Poisoned Blade
AT_034.text: Your Hero Power gives this weapon +1 Attack instead of replacing it.

AT_035.flavor: Can you hold these eggs for just a second?  I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.
AT_035.name: Beneath the Grounds
AT_035.text: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your opponent's deck. When drawn, you summon a 4/4 Nerubian.

AT_035T.name: Ambush!
AT_035T.text: When you draw this, summon a 4/4 Nerubian for your opponent. Draw a card.

AT_036.flavor: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.
AT_036.name: Anub'arak
AT_036.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand and summon a 4/4 Nerubian.

AT_037.flavor: 2 out of 2 saplings recommend that you summon the saplings.
AT_037.name: Living Roots
AT_037.text: Choose One - Deal $2 damage; or Summon two 1/1 Saplings.

AT_038.flavor: She loves mana crystals, she hates mana crystals.   So fickle!
AT_038.name: Darnassus Aspirant
AT_038.text: Battlecry: Gain an empty Mana Crystal. Deathrattle: Lose a Mana Crystal.

AT_039.flavor: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him.  Yeah...  Try that.
AT_039.name: Savage Combatant
AT_039.text: Inspire: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn.

AT_040.flavor: She was born to be something.  She is just not quite sure what yet...
AT_040.name: Wildwalker

AT_041.flavor: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.
AT_041.name: Knight of the Wild
AT_041.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, reduce the Cost of this card by (1).

AT_042.flavor: That's saberTEETH, not like curved pirate blades.  That's a different kind of druid.  Druid of the Curved Pirate Blades.
AT_042.name: Druid of the Saber
AT_042.text: Choose One - Transform to gain Charge; or +1/+1 and Stealth.

AT_043.flavor: Hey!  Moon!  Can I have some mana crystals?
AT_043.name: Astral Communion
AT_043.text: Gain 10 Mana Crystals. Discard your hand.

AT_044.flavor: Is this a noun or a verb?  We will never know.
AT_044.name: Mulch
AT_044.text:
Destroy a minion.
Add a random minion to your opponent's hand.

AT_045.flavor: Call her "Tweety".  She'll find it real funny.  I PROMISE.
AT_045.name: Aviana

AT_046.flavor: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.
AT_046.name: Tuskarr Totemic

AT_047.flavor: It's nice to find a real craftsman in this day and age of mass-produced totems.
AT_047.name: Draenei Totemcarver

AT_048.flavor: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.
AT_048.name: Healing Wave
AT_048.text: Restore #7 Health. Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, Restore #14 instead.

AT_049.flavor: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating.  I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.
AT_049.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant

AT_050.flavor: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.
AT_050.name: Charged Hammer

AT_051.flavor: I'm not a shaman or anything, but isn't Elemental Destruction the opposite of what they want to do?
AT_051.name: Elemental Destruction

AT_052.flavor: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.
AT_052.name: Totem Golem

AT_054.flavor: Calling the mist doesn't sound all that great.  "Ooooh, it is slightly damp now!"
AT_054.name: The Mistcaller
AT_054.text: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand and deck +1/+1.

AT_056.name: Powershot
AT_056.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion and the minions next to it.

AT_057.flavor: Takes way better care of her pets than her brother, Unstablemaster.
AT_057.name: Stablemaster
AT_057.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast Immune this turn.

AT_058.name: King's Elekk
AT_058.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.

AT_059.name: Brave Archer
AT_059.text: Inspire: If your hand is empty, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

AT_060.flavor: You'll never guess what's in that conveniently bear-sized, bear-smelling box.
AT_060.name: Bear Trap
AT_060.text: Secret: After your hero is attacked, summon a 3/3 Bear with Taunt.

AT_061.flavor:
Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: "It's go time.  Lock and load."
This card pays homage to that special moment.
AT_061.name: Lock and Load
AT_061.text: Each time you cast a spell this turn, add a random Hunter card to your hand.

AT_063.flavor: With the help of his trusty sidekick Dreadscale, the giant jormungar Acidmaw is ready to face any knight!
AT_063.name: Acidmaw
AT_063.text: Whenever another minion takes damage, destroy it.

AT_063T.flavor: Let's be clear about this:  ACIDMAW is the sidekick.
AT_063T.name: Dreadscale
AT_063T.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all other minions.

AT_064.flavor: You might think bashing doesn't take a lot of practice.  It doesn't.
AT_064.name: Bash

AT_065.flavor: "King's Attacker" is a shield.  Funny, huh?
AT_065.name: King's Defender
AT_065.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Taunt, gain +1 Durability.

AT_066.flavor: "Four out of three orcs struggle with math." - Angry Zurge
AT_066.name: Orgrimmar Aspirant

AT_067.flavor: Playing him also gets you into the Magnataur Beta.
AT_067.name: Magnataur Alpha
AT_067.text:
Also damages the minions next to whomever
he attacks.

AT_068.flavor: The best offense is a good defense.
AT_068.name: Bolster

AT_070.flavor: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat?  NOTHING.
AT_070.name: Skycap'n Kragg
AT_070.text: Charrrrrge Costs (1) less for each friendly Pirate.

AT_071.flavor: "Put more spikes on her.  No, more spikes.  What part of 'more spikes' do you not understand?  MORE SPIKES!" - Alexstrasza
AT_071.name: Alexstrasza's Champion
AT_071.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Charge.

AT_072.flavor: Leader of the Alliance!  Father of Anduin!  Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.
AT_072.name: Varian Wrynn
AT_072.text: Battlecry: Draw 3 cards. Put any minions you drew directly into the battlefield.

AT_073.flavor: Competition can be an inspiration to improve oneself.  Or kill all the competitors.
AT_073.name: Competitive Spirit
AT_073.text: Secret: When your turn starts, give your minions +1/+1.

AT_074.name: Seal of Champions
AT_074.text: Give a minion +3 Attack and Divine Shield.

AT_075.flavor: He doesn't even get Sundays off.  Every day he's hostling.
AT_075.name: Warhorse Trainer
AT_075.text: Your Silver Hand Recruits have +1 Attack.

AT_075E.name: Might of the Hostler
AT_075E.text: Warhorse Trainer is granting this minion +1 Attack.

AT_076.flavor: Hee hee!  Look at his cute little feet.
AT_076.name: Murloc Knight

AT_077.flavor: The stripes make it look like a candy cane, but we recommend against licking it.
AT_077.name: Argent Lance
AT_077.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, +1 Durability.

AT_078.flavor: You have to get past the vendors first.  So many are lost to shopping...
AT_078.name: Enter the Coliseum
AT_078.text: Destroy all minions except each player's highest Attack minion.

AT_079.flavor: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.
AT_079.name: Mysterious Challenger
AT_079.text: Battlecry: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.

AT_080.flavor: He'll never admit it, but he pushes you hard because he really cares about you.
AT_080.name: Garrison Commander
AT_080.text: You can use your Hero Power twice a turn.

AT_081.flavor: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.
AT_081.name: Eadric the Pure
AT_081.text: Battlecry: Change all enemy minions' Attack to 1.

AT_083.flavor: Check it out.  You can do barrel rolls on this thing.
AT_083.name: Dragonhawk Rider

AT_084.flavor: Lance Carrier is an obscure entry level position in orcish armies.  A mystery, since orcs don't generally use lances.
AT_084.name: Lance Carrier

AT_085.flavor: Not a good basis for a system of government.
AT_085.name: Maiden of the Lake

AT_086.flavor: Listen all y'all it's a saboteur!
AT_086.name: Saboteur
AT_086.text: Battlecry: Your opponent's Hero Power costs (5) more next turn.

AT_086E.name: Villainy
AT_086E.text: Your Hero Power costs (5) more this turn.

AT_088.flavor: This champion has learned from the best.  Except for his target selection.
AT_088.name: Mogor's Champion
AT_088.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.

AT_089.flavor: Underneath all that impressive armor, he's just skin and bones.  Okay, maybe just bones.
AT_089.name: Boneguard Lieutenant

AT_090.flavor: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.
AT_090.name: Mukla's Champion

AT_091.flavor: The medic tournament is less entertaining than the Grand Tournament.
AT_091.name: Tournament Medic

AT_092.flavor: He's a lot cooler than Magma Rager.
AT_092.name: Ice Rager

AT_093.flavor: Ironically, the natural enemy of the snobold is THE CANDLE.
AT_093.name: Frigid Snobold

AT_094.flavor: At first he liked juggling chain saws, but then he thought, "Flames are better!  Because FIRE!"
AT_094.name: Flame Juggler
AT_094.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.

AT_095.flavor: He used to be a librarian.  Old habits die hard.
AT_095.name: Silent Knight

AT_096.flavor: It takes a lot to wind him up.
AT_096.name: Clockwork Knight

AT_097.flavor: He was so excited to get season tickets to this year's Grand Tournament.  He normally doesn't get them at first and has to buy them from Ogre scalpers.
AT_097.name: Tournament Attendee

AT_099.flavor: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.
AT_099.name: Kodorider

AT_100.flavor: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization.  The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.
AT_100.name: Silver Hand Regent

AT_101.flavor: What did the pits ever do to you?
AT_101.name: Pit Fighter

AT_102.flavor: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!
AT_102.name: Captured Jormungar

AT_103.flavor: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.
AT_103.name: North Sea Kraken

AT_104.flavor: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...
AT_104.name: Tuskarr Jouster
AT_104.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore 7 Health to your hero.

AT_105.flavor: Don't worry.  With a little skin cream he's going to clear right up.
AT_105.name: Injured Kvaldir

AT_106.flavor: When there's something strange (say, a gibbering demon) in your neighborhood, who are you going to call?
AT_106.name: Light's Champion

AT_108.flavor: Yep.  It's a horse... wearing armor... going to war.
AT_108.name: Armored Warhorse
AT_108.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Charge.

AT_109.flavor: Who argent watches the Argent Watchman?
AT_109.name: Argent Watchman
AT_109.text: Can't attack. Inspire: Can attack as normal this turn.

AT_110.flavor: Meets monthly with the gladiators to discuss career goals.
AT_110.name: Coliseum Manager
AT_110.text: Inspire: Return this minion to your hand.

AT_111.flavor: Menu:  Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks.  It's hard serving a diverse clientele.
AT_111.name: Refreshment Vendor

AT_112.flavor: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.
AT_112.name: Master Jouster
AT_112.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.

AT_113.flavor: Join the Argent Crusade!  We have attractive tabards and you get to carry really nice swords!
AT_113.name: Recruiter
AT_113.text: Inspire: Add a 2/2 Squire to your hand.

AT_114.flavor: To be honest, heckling is not the most effective form of evil.
AT_114.name: Evil Heckler

AT_115.flavor: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?
AT_115.name: Fencing Coach
AT_115.text: Battlecry: The next time you use your Hero Power, it costs (2) less.

AT_116.flavor: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority #1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!
AT_116.name: Wyrmrest Agent
AT_116.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.

AT_117.name: Master of Ceremonies
AT_117.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Spell Damage, gain +2/+2.

AT_118.flavor: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness.  Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.
AT_118.name: Grand Crusader
AT_118.text: Battlecry: Add a random Paladin card to your hand.

AT_119.flavor: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!
AT_119.name: Kvaldir Raider

AT_120.flavor: Don't ask him about the beard.  JUST DON'T.
AT_120.name: Frost Giant
AT_120.text: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.

AT_121.name: Crowd Favorite
AT_121.text: Whenever you play a card with Battlecry, gain +1/+1.

AT_122.flavor: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds.  For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!
AT_122.name: Gormok the Impaler
AT_122.text: Battlecry: If you have at least 4 other minions, deal 4 damage.

AT_123.flavor: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!
AT_123.name: Chillmaw
AT_123.text: [x]Taunt Deathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.

AT_124.flavor: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament.  It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.
AT_124.name: Bolf Ramshield
AT_124.text: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.

AT_125.flavor: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target.  The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.
AT_125.name: Icehowl

AT_127.flavor: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion.  Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.
AT_127.name: Nexus-Champion Saraad
AT_127.text: Inspire: Add a random spell to your hand.

AT_128.flavor: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.
AT_128.name: The Skeleton Knight
AT_128.text: Deathrattle: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, return this to your hand.

AT_129.name: Fjola Lightbane
AT_129.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.

AT_130.flavor: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.
AT_130.name: Sea Reaver
AT_130.text: When you draw this, deal 1 damage to your minions.

AT_131.name: Eydis Darkbane
AT_131.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.

AT_132.flavor: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.
AT_132.name: Justicar Trueheart
AT_132.text: Battlecry: Replace your starting Hero Power with a better one.

AT_132_SHAMANA.name: Healing Totem
AT_132_SHAMANA.text: At the end of your turn, restore 1 Health to all friendly minions.

AT_133.flavor: It's not HER fault you didn't put a spinning saw blade on your horse.
AT_133.name: Gadgetzan Jouster
AT_133.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain +1/+1.

EX1_091.text: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.

EX1_093.flavor: You wouldnt think that Argus would need this much defending.  But it does.

EX1_097.flavor: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.

EX1_102.flavor: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone.  It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.

EX1_102.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.

EX1_103.flavor: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths.  So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

EX1_105.flavor: His mother said that he was just big boned.
EX1_105.name: Mountain Giant
EX1_105.text: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.

EX1_110.flavor: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.
EX1_110.name: Cairne Bloodhoof

EX1_112.flavor: He's the leader of the gnomes, and an incredible inventor.  He's getting better, too; He turns things into chickens WAY less than he used to.
EX1_112.howToEarnGolden: This was rewarded to players who helped test the Store during the Beta.
EX1_112.name: Gelbin Mekkatorque

EX1_116.flavor: At least he has Angry Chicken.

EX1_116.text: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.

EX1_124.flavor: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent:  It takes a long time to get blood stains out of leather armor.

EX1_126.flavor: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.
EX1_126.name: Betrayal
EX1_126.text: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it.

EX1_128.flavor: Rogues conceal everything but their emotions.  You can't get 'em to shut up about feelings.

EX1_128.text: Give your minions Stealth until your nextturn.

EX1_129.flavor: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.

EX1_129.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions. Drawa card.

EX1_130.name: Noble Sacrifice
EX1_130.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.

EX1_131.flavor: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

EX1_132.flavor: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.
EX1_132.name: Eye for an Eye
EX1_132.text: Secret: When your hero takes damage, dealthat much damage to the enemy hero.

EX1_133.flavor: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

EX1_134.flavor: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities.  Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.
EX1_134.name: SI:7 Agent

EX1_136.flavor: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time.  Its a mystery!
EX1_136.name: Redemption

EX1_137.flavor: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

EX1_137.text: Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.

EX1_144.flavor: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance.  Crowds love it.

EX1_145O.name: Preparation
EX1_145O.text: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.

EX1_154B.name: Wrath

EX1_155.flavor: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature."  Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."

EX1_158.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."

EX1_160.flavor: Never look a panther in the eye.  Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'?  Well, it's one of those.

EX1_160.text: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.

EX1_161.name: Naturalize
EX1_161.text:
Destroy a minion.
Your opponent draws 2cards.

EX1_162.flavor: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.

EX1_164.flavor: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

EX1_165.flavor: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!

EX1_166.flavor: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

EX1_169.flavor: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.

EX1_169.text: Gain 2 Mana Crystals this turn only.

EX1_170.flavor: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray.  And plate armor.

EX1_170.text: Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.

EX1_173.flavor: Balance is important to druids.  This card is perfectly balanced.
EX1_173.name: Starfire

EX1_178.flavor: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?"  You lose if you get crushed to death.
EX1_178.name: Ancient of War

EX1_238.flavor: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

EX1_241.flavor: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!
EX1_241.name: Lava Burst

EX1_243.flavor: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

EX1_245.flavor: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?
EX1_245.name: Earth Shock

EX1_246.flavor: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?

EX1_248.flavor: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

EX1_249.flavor: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.
EX1_249.name: Baron Geddon

EX1_251.flavor: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

EX1_258.flavor: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.

EX1_259.flavor: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

EX1_274.flavor: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

EX1_275.name: Cone of Cold

EX1_277.flavor: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.
EX1_277.name: Arcane Missiles
EX1_277.text: Deal $3 damage randomly split among all enemies.

EX1_279.flavor: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

EX1_283.flavor: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...
EX1_283.name: Frost Elemental

EX1_284.flavor: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.
EX1_284.name: Azure Drake

EX1_287.flavor: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't?  The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

EX1_289.flavor: This is Rank 1.  Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.

EX1_295.flavor: Ice is nice, and will suffice!

EX1_298.flavor: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord.  Summoning Ragnaros often doesnt work out the way you want it to.

EX1_301.flavor: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.
EX1_301.name: Felguard
EX1_301.text: Taunt Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.

EX1_302.flavor: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.

EX1_304.flavor: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

EX1_304.text: [x]Battlecry: Destroy both adjacent minions and gain their Attack and Health.

EX1_308.flavor: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.

EX1_309.flavor: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

EX1_310.flavor: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

EX1_313.flavor: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

EX1_315.flavor: NOT LESS THAN 1!  Don't get any ideas!
EX1_315.name: Summoning Portal
EX1_315.text: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).

EX1_316E.name: Power Overwhelming

EX1_332.flavor: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.

EX1_341.flavor: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

Put a copy of
a random minion from
your opponent's deck into the battlefield.

EX1_350.flavor: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.

EX1_355.flavor: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

EX1_360.flavor: This card makes something really damp.  Oh wait.  That's "Humidity."

EX1_362.flavor: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs.  I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."

EX1_363.flavor: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.

EX1_363E2.text: When this minion attacks, the enemy player draws a card.

EX1_365.text: Draw a card and dealdamage equal toits Cost.

EX1_366.flavor: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

EX1_382.flavor: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

EX1_383.flavor: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

EX1_384.text: Deal $8 damage randomly split among all enemies.

EX1_390.flavor: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.

EX1_392.flavor: "You won't like me when I'm angry."

EX1_393.flavor: If an Amani berserker asks "Joo lookin' at me?!", the correct response is "Nah, mon".

EX1_396.flavor: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King.   BOOOORRRINNG!
EX1_396.name: Mogu'shan Warden

EX1_398.flavor: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!
EX1_398.name: Arathi Weaponsmith

EX1_399.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3Attack.

EX1_400.flavor: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.

EX1_402.flavor: She accepts guild funds for repairs!
EX1_402.name: Armorsmith
EX1_402.text: Whenever a friendly miniontakes damage, gain 1 Armor.

EX1_405.flavor: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game??  This is no easy job.

EX1_407.flavor: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?

EX1_409.name: Upgrade!
EX1_409.text: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.

EX1_410.flavor: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

EX1_410.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.

EX1_411.flavor: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe.  Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession.  Quite the mystery!
EX1_411.name: Gorehowl

EX1_412.flavor: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.
EX1_412.name: Raging Worgen

EX1_414.flavor: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes!  Maybe not his best decision.
EX1_414.name: Grommash Hellscream

EX1_507.flavor: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound?  Nope!  Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!
EX1_507.name: Murloc Warleader

EX1_508.flavor: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesnt mean much.

EX1_509.flavor: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.
EX1_509.name: Murloc Tidecaller
EX1_509.text: Whenever you summon a Murloc, gain +1 Attack.

EX1_522.flavor: Hes not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

EX1_531.flavor: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.
EX1_531.name: Scavenging Hyena

EX1_533.flavor: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.
EX1_533.name: Misdirection

EX1_534.flavor: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.
EX1_534.name: Savannah Highmane

EX1_536.flavor: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.
EX1_536.name: Eaglehorn Bow

EX1_537.flavor: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot.  Then duck.
EX1_537.name: Explosive Shot
EX1_537.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion and $2 damage to adjacent ones.

EX1_538.flavor: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

EX1_538.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.

EX1_539.name: Kill Command
EX1_539.text:
Deal $3 damage. If you control a Beast, deal
$5 damage instead.

EX1_543.flavor: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you dont like standing in front of you.
EX1_543.name: King Krush

EX1_544.flavor: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!
EX1_544.name: Flare

EX1_549.flavor: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface.  Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.

EX1_554.flavor: Why did it have to be snakes?
EX1_554.name: Snake Trap
EX1_554.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.

EX1_556.flavor: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."
EX1_556.name: Harvest Golem

EX1_557.flavor: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).
EX1_557.name: Nat Pagle
EX1_557.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.

EX1_558.flavor: That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!
EX1_558.name: Harrison Jones
EX1_558.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.

EX1_559.flavor: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.
EX1_559.name: Archmage Antonidas

EX1_560.flavor: Time to write some flavor text.
EX1_560.name: Nozdormu
EX1_560.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take theirturns.

EX1_561.flavor: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.
EX1_561.name: Alexstrasza
EX1_561.text: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.

EX1_562.flavor: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.
EX1_562.name: Onyxia
EX1_562.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.

EX1_563.flavor: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic.  He gets so mad!
EX1_563.name: Malygos

EX1_564.flavor: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.
EX1_564.name: Faceless Manipulator
EX1_564.targetingArrowText: Become a copy of a minion.
EX1_564.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.

EX1_565.name: Flametongue Totem

EX1_567.flavor: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall.  His name is a total coincidence.
EX1_567.name: Doomhammer

EX1_570.name: Bite
EX1_570.text: Give your hero +4Attack this turn and 4 Armor.
